message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.CY 

This paper deals with a security issue in Bitcoin, specifically the block-withholding attack. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the Blockchain, which falls under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper proposes a solution that involves communication between nodes, which falls under the category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the mining process, which falls under the category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses the compliance of the solution with nodes churn, which falls under the category of cs.CY (Computers and Society).
